title: Question on Fizz 5.17 Change
body: Will Chum the Waters (R) amp up True Damage (i.e. Ignite?) It says magic damage and not physical, but no mention of true damage (which it amped up before I believe)....

replies.body: No, Fizz ult will only amp magic damage. As Angry Monster points out the intention with true damage is that nothing increases or decreases its damage (though some things will absorb or nullify it, like Janna E or Kayle ult).
I think ahri's charm lost damage amp functionality a while ago
I've heard people say Poppy's ultimate increases Ignite's damage. Is that a myth?

> [{quoted}](name=Sylian,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zAsBAmz6,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-09-02T14:10:24.368+0000)
>
> I've heard people say Poppy's ultimate increases Ignite's damage. Is that a myth?

Used to, was changed (along with Vlad ult) a while back.

true damage does not ever get amped.
The true damage from Ahri's Q used to get amped, back when E gave a +20% damage amp :(
i think that is false. I think it amped 1 on the way out not on the way back.
No, If Ahri Was Real is right. That was explicitly mentioned in the Charm's tooltip.
then that was a one of, that does not even currently exist. IMO that never should of been that way then.

> [{quoted}](name=Angry Monster,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zAsBAmz6,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-02T08:00:04.466+0000)

> then that was a one of, that does not even currently exist. IMO that never should of been that way then.

It was specifically stated in the tooltip that it "increases all damage dealt to the target. Orb of Deception's true damage is also increased by this effect". Otherwise there would have been be cases where your Q doing true damage on the second pass would actually be a downside.
